vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
καταχθόν-ιος, ον,
also η, ον [Refs 3rd c.BC+]:— subterranean, Ζεὺς καταχθόνιος, i.e. Pluto, [Refs 8th c.BC+]; of Pluto, Demeter, Persephone, and the Erinyes, [Refs 4th c.AD+] M.; = Latin Di Manes, [Refs]; κ.θεοί, = Latin Di Manes, frequently in sepulchral Inscrr., [Refs]
vocabInfos.shortDef: under the earth, subterranean; this may refer to the dead as a class of people, which generally are regarded as inhabiting the underworld. It is likely a more general term than the specific names for the abode of the dead: Hades, Gehenna, Tartaros, etc.
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
under the earth, subterranean; this may refer to the dead as a class of people, which generally are regarded as inhabiting the underworld. It is likely a more general term than the specific names for the abode of the dead: Hades, Gehenna, Tartaros, etc.
under the earth, subterranean, infernal, Phil. 2:10*
